revised_title: Sphagnum-Dominated Peat Bogs: Acidity and Ecological Effects of Deposited Sulphur and Nitrogen Compounds
tldr: This article examines the ecological effects of deposited sulphur and nitrogen compounds in Sphagnum-dominated peat bogs, which are naturally acid ecosystems. The study focuses on a peat bog in the northern Pennines and explores the importance of different sources of acidity. The research also investigates the interconversion of sulphur- and nitrogen-containing compounds and their impact on acidity levels.
